newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH PULP MAKER Q1 LOSS CZK 145 MLN.
newsitem.headline: CZECH PULP MAKER Q1 LOSS CZK 145 MLN.

text.p: ending March 31, 1997, according to Czech accounting standards
NOTE: Full company name is Biocel Paskov a.s. . The
firm is a leading pulp maker in the Czech Republic.
The Cyprus-based consortium Daventree of Bahamas-based
investor Michael Dingman's Stratton Investments and Czech
investment house Harvard Capital and Consulting holds a 33
percent stake in Biocel. Bankovni Holding a.s. , an
investment fund controlled by bank IPB a.s. holds an
Biocel shares are traded on the main market of the Prague
Stock Exchange (PSE). Results were provided by the PSE.
